title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4121.3 - Disposition of protest
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4121.3 - Disposition of protest

State Regulations
(a) Where a
protest is made prior to a race, and the judges find satisfactory evidence to
warrant excluding a horse, such horse shall be scratched unless the owner
thereof in good faith requests that the horse start under protest and waives
any right of reimbursement against the track under section 4121.20 of this

Part, in the event the commission should thereafter make a determination
allowing said protest. Such request shall be granted by the judges except where
permitting said horse to compete would be contrary to the public
interest. (b) Where a protest is
made prior to or after the race and the horse protested has started the judges
shall notify the track to withhold payment of the portion of the purse affected
pending determination by the commission. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4121.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
